detaileddescription.para: The sequence should be continued normally.
The sampling should be repeated. New samples or sample should be read from the ADC and written in the same place as the recent ones.
The sequence should be finished immediately.

briefdescription.para: Action to be performed after a sampling is done.

memberdef.definition: typedef enum adc_action(* adc_sequence_callback) (const struct device *dev, const struct adc_sequence *sequence, uint16_t sampling_index)
memberdef.argsstring: )(const struct device *dev, const struct adc_sequence *sequence, uint16_t sampling_index)
memberdef.name: adc_sequence_callback

briefdescription.para: Type definition of the optional callback function to be called after a requested sampling is done.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.

Pointer to the sequence structure that triggered the sampling. This parameter points to a copy of the structure that was supplied to the call that started the sampling sequence, thus it cannot be used with the CONTAINER_OF() macro to retrieve some other data associated with the sequence. Instead, the adc_sequence_options::user_data field should be used for such purpose.
Index (0-65535) of the sampling done.

simplesect.para: Action to be performed by the driver. See adc_action.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* adc_api_channel_setup) (const struct device *dev, const struct adc_channel_cfg *channel_cfg)
memberdef.name: adc_api_channel_setup

briefdescription.para: Type definition of ADC API function for configuring a channel. See adc_channel_setup() for argument descriptions.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* adc_api_read) (const struct device *dev, const struct adc_sequence *sequence)
memberdef.name: adc_api_read

briefdescription.para: Type definition of ADC API function for setting a read request. See adc_read() for argument descriptions.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* adc_api_read_async) (const struct device *dev, const struct adc_sequence *sequence, struct k_poll_signal *async)
memberdef.argsstring: )(const struct device *dev, const struct adc_sequence *sequence, struct k_poll_signal *async)
memberdef.name: adc_api_read_async

briefdescription.para: Type definition of ADC API function for setting an asynchronous read request. See adc_read_async() for argument descriptions.
Invert the application of gain to a measurement value.

detaileddescription.para: For example, if the gain passed in is ADC_GAIN_1_6 and the referenced value is 10, the value after the function returns is 60.

parameterdescription.para: the gain used to amplify the input signal.
a pointer to a value that initially has the effect of the applied gain but has that effect removed when this function successfully returns. If the gain cannot be reversed the value remains unchanged.
if the gain was successfully reversed
if the gain could not be interpreted

memberdef.argsstring: (int32_t ref_mv, enum adc_gain gain, uint8_t resolution, int32_t *valp)
memberdef.name: adc_raw_to_millivolts

briefdescription.para: Convert a raw ADC value to millivolts.

detaileddescription.para: This function performs the necessary conversion to transform a raw ADC measurement to a voltage in millivolts.

parameterdescription.para: the reference voltage used for the measurement, in millivolts. This may be from adc_ref_internal() or a known external reference.
the ADC gain configuration used to sample the input
the number of bits in the absolute value of the sample. For differential sampling this may be one less than the resolution in struct adc_sequence.
pointer to the raw measurement value on input, and the corresponding millivolt value on successful conversion. If conversion fails the stored value is left unchanged.
on successful conversion
if the gain is not reversible

detaileddescription.para: It is required to call this function and configure each channel before it is selected for a read request.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Channel configuration.
On success.
If a parameter with an invalid value has been provided.

detaileddescription.para:
dev
Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
sequence
Structure specifying requested sequence of samplings.
If invoked from user mode, any sequence struct options for callback must be NULL.

parameterdescription.para: On success.
If a parameter with an invalid value has been provided.
If the provided buffer is to small to hold the results of all requested samplings.
If the requested mode of operation is not supported.

If another sampling was triggered while the previous one was still in progress. This may occur only when samplings are done with intervals, and it indicates that the selected interval was too small. All requested samples are written in the buffer, but at least some of them were taken with an extra delay compared to what was scheduled.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, const struct adc_sequence *sequence, struct k_poll_signal *async)
memberdef.name: adc_read_async

detaileddescription.para:
This function is available only if embed:rst:inline :kconfig:`CONFIG_ADC_ASYNC` is selected.
If invoked from user mode, any sequence struct options for callback must be NULL.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Structure specifying requested sequence of samplings.
Pointer to a valid and ready to be signaled struct k_poll_signal. (Note: if NULL this function will not notify the end of the transaction, and whether it went successfully or not).

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative error code otherwise. See adc_read() for a list of possible error codes.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the voltage corresponding to ADC_REF_INTERNAL, measured in millivolts.

simplesect.para: a positive value is the reference voltage value. Returns zero if reference voltage information is not available.
